description: "Night-time curfews shall apply from 11:00pm to 5am" in Tonga

"Night-time curfews shall apply from 11:00pm to 5am" in Tonga.
The curfew will now be from 12:00AM to 5:00AM daily, effective from June 11, 2020. UPDATE: The original curfew started at 11:00PM, it will now be relaxed and start at 12:00AM, one hour later.

Tonga invoked a Public Health Emergency Order on March 13, and the Declaration of an Emergency Notifiable Condition.

This was followed by the declaration of a State of Emergency on 20 March

description:
Friday, April 17, 2020 - 20:52
Tonga has extended its State of Emergency for another month until May 15
Tonga’s State of Emergency that was due to end today at 8:00pm 17 May has been extended until 8.00pm 11 June 2020, the Prime Minister, Hon. Dr Pohiva Tu‘i‘onetoa declared this afternoon 15 May 2020.

Tonga’s State of Emergency that was due to end today at 8:00pm 17 May has been extended until 8.00pm 11 June 2020, the Prime Minister, Hon. Dr Pohiva Tu‘i‘onetoa declared this afternoon 15 May 2020. 
Tonga's State of Emergency is set to now end on July 8. UPDATE: The original State of Emergency was set to last until June 11, it has been extended to July 8.

Tonga’s State of Emergency that was due to end today at 8:00pm 17 May has been extended until 8.00pm 11 June 2020, the Prime Minister, Hon. Dr Pohiva Tu‘i‘onetoa declared this afternoon 15 May 2020. 
Tonga’s Prime Minister Pohiva Tu’i’onetoa announced the extension of the State of Emergency for another month until 04 August. UPDATE: The original State of Emergency was set to end July 8, it has now been extended to August 4, 2020.

Friday, April 17, 2020 - 20:52
Tonga has extended its State of Emergency for another month until May 15. 
Tonga's State of Emergency is extended until August 31, 2020 at 8:00PM. UPDATE: Tonga’s State of Emergency has been extended because of the COVID-19 Pandemic from 8:00pm today, Tuesday, 4 August until 8:00pm 31 August.

description:
Effective 23 March, Tonga closes its borders, including international flights, cruise ships and yachts for 14 days. The restriction affects Fiji Airways, Air New Zealand, Virgin Australia, and Talofa Airways flights.

Tonga extends incoming flight bans for Fiji Airways, Air New Zealand, and Talofa Airways until September 12, 2020. UPDATE: The restriction no longer effects Virgin Australia airlines, but still effects Fiji Airways, Air New Zealand, and Talofa Airways flights. The original restriction was set to last until April 6, but on it has been extended to September 12, 2020.
In Tonga (under the state of emergeny regulations), all foreign nationals are banned from entering Tonga after March 20, 2020 until June 12, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

Trinidad and Tobago announces that pilots are obligated to complete forms, in which they have report an incident on board an aircraft of passengers who have suddenly fallen ill and are presenting with a fever.
Any passenger suspected of the virus would be checked on at the airport by a country medical officer, with isolation capacities ready at a nearby hospital - from 22nd of January onwards.

description: In Tonga, a national full lockdown has been declared by Tonga's Prime Minister Pohiva Tu'i'onetoa for one week starting  Sunday March 29th, 2020 at 1:00am and ending Sunday April 5, 2020. Non-essential movement outside of residences will be prohibited. The exception to the isolation order includes purchasing or supplying essential consumer goods, obtaining medical supplies or seeking medical assistance, access to banking and other financial services and attending work as a member of an essential service provider.
Nationwide Lockdown in Tonga begins on the 29th of March 2020
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: In Tonga his majesty’s Government has established a COVID-19 task force comprised of key Government Ministries and Chaired by the Hon. Minister for Health, assisted by the Hon. Minister for Meteorology, Energy, Information, Disaster Management, Environment, Climate Change and Communications (MEIDECC); and Hon. Minister for Education and Training (MET) after February 4th, 2020.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Tonga introduced an economic and social stimulus package to combat COVID 19 on April 2nd, 2020.

The Government of Tonga and the World Bank have provided conditional cash transfers to 1,162 Tongan households at a project launch in the Tongan capital, Nuku’alofa as part of an effort to address the financial constraints many households face in keeping their children in secondary school. Part of the transfer will be an additional one-off payment of TOP200, provided to assist vulnerable Tongan families deal with the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic. The families who received both payments were identified through a nationally run poverty means test.
type_text: cash transfer to parents to assist with financial hardships resulting from COVID-19
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
The Tonga National Tripartite Committee (TNTC) announced on August 6 that they will conduct a national rapid assessment on the impact CoViD-19 on businesses and employment. The assessment will run from 10 August until 7 September.
TNTC is organizing the survey with support from the International Labour Organization (ILO).
The Ministry of Trade & Economic Development CEO, Distaquaine Tu'ihalamaka said the survey will look at three key areas: how many businesses have been negatively impacted, how many jobs have been or will be impacted, and the type of sector impacted because of CoViD-19.
The tourism sector will be assessed separately.
type_text: Survey to assess CoViD-19 impact on businesses

description: Tonga's Ministry of Health announced COVID-19 advice for pregnant and breastfeeding women in a public awareness measure. Pregnant women are advised to avoid all non-essential overseas travel. Pregnant women do not appear to be more susceptible to COVID-19, but caution it advised because they are at high risk of developing severe symptoms if they get COVID-19. There is no evidence that the virus can pass to a baby during pregnancy or an increase risk of miscarriage in relation to COVID-19. There is no evidence that the virus can be carried in breast milk so breast feeding is safe.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
